author: protolambda
content: FYI: I'm analyzing network traffic transmit/received interactions between clients. Taking 5% Pyrmont nodes offline at a time to isolate the problem. Attestation performance will take a small hit, but everything is ok.

author: prestonvanloon
content: quick question on your analysis, do you factor in peer counts?

author: protolambda
content: I'm averaging 20 clients of each type, and it's about the difference between input and output of the client. It should be symmetric, but it's not so at all times, hence me debugging this.

author: prestonvanloon
content: ok cool, thanks for the answer

author: protolambda
content: In particular: Teku is receiving more data every epoch boundary, and Prysm + Nimbus are sending more data every epoch boundary

author: pipermerriam
content: Just to tack onto the recent Chain history vs no chain history etc, I'm trying to solve this with <#688086042959806497> if you want to help be part of the solution I'd be glad to have some more collaborators.  It'd be nice for all ethereum clients to be able to be able to drop 250+gb of chain history without negatively effecting the network.

author: prestonvanloon
content: yeah, i wonder why there are differences
